judges: Before Fbazee, C. J., Simpson, Kephabt, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decree of disbarment is affirmed on the opinion of the court below, which considered the case as a court in banc. Costs to be paid by appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: George J. Edwards, Jr., for appellant.
G. Brewster Rhoads, with him Frank W. Melvin, Chairman for the Committee of Censors, Philadelphia Bar Association, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Bonner’s Case.
Argued December 6, 1934.
Before Fbazee, C. J., Simpson, Kephabt, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
January 7, 1935:
George J. Edwards, Jr., for appellant.
G. Brewster Rhoads, with him Frank W. Melvin, Chairman for the Committee of Censors, Philadelphia Bar Association, for appellee.
